title: What is the importance of reading the Philippine history? - Quora

response.answer_text: I’m just curious, do you get along well with people? By this I mean do you understand other people’s cultures? Do’s and don’ts things that you can say to them, and other things you simply should never say? What sort of things in these people’s history are they happy about, and other topics they get quite angry if they are confronted with because they know more about the topic than you do? It is my hope that you now are beginning to grasp an understanding of why it is important to learn about history, and as much about it as you can so you won’t look like a buffoon, meaning really stupid. But here is the second point of my answer, if you are now all upset than instead of yelling at me ask yourself why are you upset? More than likely you’ve heard this before and you don’t want to be bothered by it because you want to play your games on the net instead of learning something useful and that could help you many times over in the future. But this has come about by the lack of education that is NOT being taught in our country these days, and it should scare you deeply. For there is nothing worse than not knowing, or even having a clue about something, and the way this world is going today that could mean the difference between living and dying. But this is just an observation from someone who keeps an open mind and tries to learn as much as possible. Hope this give you some incentive to do the same.
